description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

Google Works partners with stakeholders in People Operations, Finance, Real Estate, Legal, Marketing, and other product areas to build solutions for Google and Googlers. The People Operations Works Engineering team is responsible for developing, implementing, and managing Google's HR infrastructure and applications. Over the past several years, Google's scale and complexity has grown tremendously. As a Program Manager, you will combine innovative engineering programs with industry-leading products and practices to meet our short-term and long-term needs.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in people management, leading and motivating teams.
  • Experience in executive communications and working with stakeholders across levels and regions.
  • Experience in program management and data analysis.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in an enterprise applications business domain such as HR or Finance.
  • Experience working with third-party products, including SaaS applications.
  • Ability to influence Business and Engineering stakeholders.
  • Ability to work well as part of a team, with a high tolerance for ambiguity and within a rapidly changing environment.
  • Excellent business partnering skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage a team of program managers and business systems analysts across multiple sites.
  • Collaborate with Engineering and UX teams to drive design, development, implementation, and maintenance of HR solutions, with a mixture of first-party and third-party products. Partner with teams to co-manage joint initiatives.
  • Gain sufficient expertise on industry-leading HR products to lead buy versus build analysis for areas across People Operations Works.
  • Help drive technology and product roadmaps for HR domain areas.
  • Work with key business leaders at a director/VP level to determine priorities, objectives and key results (OKRs), and overall strategy.
title: Program Manager, People Operations, Google Works
